Garlic Shrimp
  Print Full 
3 X 5
4 X 6
Source: Casual Cuisines of the World - Taverna
Recipe Reviews Save Recipe view my favorites email recipe to a friend
Rating:   Reviews: 3 See Reviews
Rate/Review this Recipe
Active Time:  10 Minutes
Total Time:  10 Minutes
Yield:  Serves 4
In Spanish tavernas, these shrimp; fragrant with garlic and olive oil; are brought to the table sizzling in a little metal pan. Have plenty of bread on hand to sop up the delicious pan juices. Serve with lemon wedges, if desired.
RECIPE INGREDIENTS
1/4 cup olive oil
4 large cloves garlic, finely minced
1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
1 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
2 tablespoons dry sherry
1 teaspoon paprika
Chopped fresh flat-leaf (Italian) parsley for garnish
You May Also Like
Shrimp In Garlic Sauce
See More Similar Recipes »
DIRECTIONS
In a saute pan over medium heat, warm the olive oil. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and saute for 1 minute. Raise the heat to high and add the shrimp, lemon juice, sherry and paprika. Stir well, then saute, stirring briskly, until the shrimp turn pink and curl slightly, about 3 minutes. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper and sprinkle with parsley. Serve hot.
Recipe reprinted by permission of Weldon Owen. All rights reserved.
Date Added: 01/01/2008
Part of These Recipe Collections Find Similar Recipes »
Spanish Tapas Appetizers: Easy Small Plates
Nutrition Facts per Serving
Yield: Yield:  Serves 4
Calories: 257
Fat. Total: 16g
Protein: 23g
Carbohydrates, Total: 4g
Sodium: 170mg
% Cal. from Fat: 56%
Cholesterol: 172mg
Spotlight Recipe Review See all 3 reviews »

Rating:
by: Stuart, CT Reviewed: 03/01/2013
Needs Pimentón to be Spanish
A medium or hot pimentón is essential to make this dish Spanish. Sweet pimentón will suffice if fortified with a little ground cayenne. Forget about the crushed red pepper; the Spanish would never use that. Here's my recipe:
6 people gave this Cheers. Click here to Cheer this review. Report Violation
